title: What are some songs that could be both secular and religious? - Quora

response.answer_text: What are some songs that could be both secular and religious? Well, you didn’t specify what religion, but I’ll assume you mean something within the Judeo-Christian tradition, and written in English. Lots of folk songs, including popular “Negro spirituals,” as well as many “protest” songs of the 1960s, and many country/bluegrass songs, are at home in both religious and secular settings. The Jewish tradition also has produced a variety of popular songs with a spiritual component, or based on Biblical verses, such as Leonard Cohen’s “Halleluia,” Debbie Friedman’s “Not by might,” and others. “If I had my way” (story of Samson) “Dem bones” (Ezekiel’s vision) “Freedom” (exodus and redemption) “We shall not be moved” (steadfastness in faith) ‘Let my people go / Go down Moses” (exodus and redemption) “Oh, Mary don’t you weep” (crossing of the reed sea) “Joshua fought the battle of Jericho” “Michael row the boat ashore” “Children go where I send thee”“Git on board, little children” “Hard times come again no more” ”Going over Jordan” “Swing low, sweet chariot” “Going home” “Whither thou goest” (story of Ruth) “The wedding song” “Jesus met the woman at the well” “Blowing in the wind” “Turn, turn, turn” “Where have all the flowers gone” “If I had a hammer” “Kumbaya” “This train (don’t carry no gamblers)” “By the waters of Babylon” “Daniel prayed” “Will the circle be unbroken” “Heaven’s bright shore” “Amazing grace” “Simple gifts” “He ain’t heavy, he’s my brother” “I saw the light” “Keep on the sunny side” “I’m just a poor wayfaring stranger” “Sometimes I feel like a motherless child” “Didn’t it rain” “Day by day” “Walk that lonesome valley” “How can I keep from singing” “Light one candle” “Lord of the dance” I’m sure there are plenty more. That ought to get you started. Thanks for the A2A/
